page.title: 16PUBLIC BUILDINGS, WILLINGDON
page.content: St. Mary the Virgin is the oldest building in our area.There was a church here at the time of the Domesday Book but the present building is mainly 13th,14th and 15th century. It is a greenstone and flint building with a typical Sussex tower. Inside, the tie beam roof looks like an upside down ship. Polegate tower windmill, built in 1817, is the most complete one of its kind in Sussex. There are three sets of grinding stones and all the wooden machinery is complete. It is hoped soon to lift the jammed cap with a crane and fix it so that the mill can grind again. The last miller's daughter is one of the guides who show visitors around.
